intro: Xiphagrostis floridula, commonly known as the Florida xiphagrostis, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and wetlands. It produces small, wind-pollinated flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a threatened species and is protected in several states.
